Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Daniela Rossi. It's nice to meet you.
Hi Daniela! It's great to meet you too. How are you feeling today?
Honestly, I'm feeling pretty overwhelmed with my Graphic Design program. It's just started, and I'm already feeling the pressure.
I understand. Starting a new semester can feel intense, especially with the demands of your field. What's particularly been weighing on you?
I submitted my first major project, but I received some constructive criticism from my professor that left me questioning my skills.
That sounds really tough. Constructive feedback can sometimes feel disheartening, especially if you're already feeling insecure. How are you coping with those feelings?
I'm not sure. I just feel anxious about living up to my family's expectations, particularly since my dad is a successful painter.
I can see how that pressure could be overwhelming. It's natural to want to impress those we admire. Have you talked to anyone in your family about how you're feeling?
I haven't really. I don't want to worry them or seem like I can't handle things.
It's understandable to feel that way, but keeping things inside can sometimes make it harder to cope. It might help to share your feelings. Would you consider talking to them?
I might, but I'm nervous about it. I really don't want to fail in their eyes.
Remember, everyone has their struggles, even successful people. Talking to them might provide some comfort and support. Would you like to set a goal about reaching out to someone?
Yes, that sounds good. Maybe I can talk to my brother Matteo about it since he's studying architecture.
That sounds like a solid plan! Let's check in next week to see how that conversation goes. Does that work for you?
Definitely! Thank you for your help today. I really appreciate it.
Hi, it's me again. This week has been pretty challenging.
Welcome back, Daniela! What's been happening since we last spoke?
I talked to Matteo about my feelings. It helped a bit, but I still find it hard to voice my opinions in group projects.
I'm glad you reached out to your brother! It's great to hear it helped. When you say it's hard to voice your opinions, can you tell me more about that?
Well, I feel overshadowed by more outspoken classmates. I worry that my ideas won't be valued.
That's a common concern, especially in creative fields. Have you thought about ways to assert yourself or slowly work on expressing your thoughts?
Not really. I just kind of freeze up when it's my turn to speak.
How about setting a small goal for your next group session, like raising your hand to share at least one idea? It could help ease you back into it.
That sounds doable! I can at least try to contribute more.
That's a fantastic mindset! Taking one step at a time is key. Remember, your contributions matter just as much as anyone else's.
Thank you for that reminder. I think I really need to hear it.
Of course! Let's follow up next week to see how it goes. You're doing great, Daniela!
Hi! I'm back. I've been feeling really anxious again.
Hi, Daniela! I'm glad you're here. What's been happening this week?
I went to a family gathering, and my dad showcased his artwork. It made me feel so inferior.
I'm sorry to hear that. Family gatherings can often trigger comparisons. How did that experience make you feel?
It intensified my feelings of inadequacy. I felt like I was stuck in a shadow, and it made me less motivated in my design work.
It's tough to feel overshadowed, especially in a creative field. Have you found any ways to express those feelings after the gathering?
Not really. I just felt trapped and didn't want to talk to anyone.
It might help to express those feelings, even through journaling or creating art. Have you thought about using your creativity as an outlet?
That could be helpful! Maybe I can try channeling those feelings into a painting or a design project.
That sounds like a wonderful idea, Daniela. Art can be a therapeutic way to process emotions. Would you like to set a goal to create something this week?
Yes! I'll aim to start a new painting this weekend.
Hi, I'm back again! I did start painting this weekend.
Hi Daniela! I'm happy to see you again. That's great news! How did the painting go?
It felt really good to express myself. I think I managed to channel a lot of my feelings into it.
That's wonderful! Art is such a powerful way to express emotions. Do you feel like this helped alleviate some of your anxiety?
Yes, it did. But I still struggle with my confidence in class.
That's okay. Remember progress isn't linear, and it's great that you're finding ways to express yourself. What's the next small step you can take in class?
Maybe I can share my painting experience with my classmates, just to open up a conversation.
That sounds like a fantastic plan! Sharing your experiences can help you connect. Let's keep working together on building your confidence.
Thank you so much! I appreciate all your support. I feel hopeful about the changes I'm making.
